titleStmt.title: Albert Stephens to James F. Robinson
CWG7921

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Florence Boone County Ky
March 27th 1863
To his Excellency James F. Robinson Governor of the state of Kentucky
Sir

In may 1859 I was duly commissioned as a justice of the peace for Boone County Ky, Circumstances arising making it necessary for me to remove to the state of Missouri, I hereby tender my resignation to you hoping that your Excellency will accept the same,

Respectffuly your Obt Svt
Albert Stephens --

Albert Stevens of Boone County resigns Justice
Resignation Accp Apr 2. 1863
